Mahāvedalla Sutta：A series of questions asked by Mahā Kotthita on psychological topics - e．g．，understanding，consciousness，feeling，perception，pure mental consciousness （manoviññāna），isolated from the five faculties of bodily sense - the eye of understanding，right outlook，types of rebirth，first jhāna，etc．- and Sāriputta’s answers thereto （M．i．292 8）．

The sutta was probably originally compiled rather as a ”lesson” for learners than as a genuine enquiry by Kotthita．This sutta it was which obtained for Kotthita the rank of pre eminence among those possessing the patisambhidā．AA．i．159．
